definition: to make industrious and diligent efforts (idiom)

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa

sentences.english: Ethics, in the hope the field of hard work.
sentences.chinese: 师德，是在希望田野上的辛勤耕耘。

sentences.english: Guangzhou Lenv of hard work to win customers' trust.
sentences.chinese: 广州伦威的辛勤耕耘，赢来客户的信任。

sentences.english: I must do farm work industriously, toleration distress.
sentences.chinese: 我要辛勤耕耘，忍受苦楚。

definition: plowing and weeding/farm work/fig. to work or study diligently
to make a living by writing/to write (as an author)
heavily laden with fruit/fertile (of trees)/many noteworthy achievements
lit. to comb one's hair in the wind and wash it in the rain (idiom)/fig. to work in the open regardless of the weather
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
